title: Chinese companies still hope for New York IPOs — despite recent fraud, scandals and coronavirus
text: Many Chinese companies are still planning to list in the U.S., despite increased scrutiny on the issuers in the wake of disclosures of fraud at high-profile stocks such as Luckin Coffee.

title: U.S. stock futures retreat after Tuesday's rally

title: Oil rallies on hopes for unprecedented stockpile purchases
text: Benchmark U.S. crude rose more than 3% in early trade on Wednesday, recovering from a 10% slump the previous session on hopes for purchases by consumer countries for their strategic stockpiles on a scale not before seen.

title: Market Rally Strengthens; Why This Is The Battle We’ve Been Waiting For
text: The market is reaching a crossroads as the 50-day line reaches the 200-day line — a key point all investors will be watching. If a sell off occurs, it may be a signal that investors still should back away. But if the market continues higher, and the 50-day line does not cross below the 200-day, it would be a strong sign for optimism amid the current stock market rally.

title: The odd reality of today’s stock market

title: Dow Jones Today: Earnings Split, but Signs of Virus Easing Propel Stocks
text:
With first-quarter earnings season kicking off in force Tuesday, the major equity benchmarks rallied anew even as the reports from Dow components were mixed, indicating market participants are focusing more intently on signs that the novel coronavirus is starting to ease.

title: How To Stop The Fiscal Emergency Facing The U.S.
